name: Killyhevlin Hotel

reviews.text: Everything from booking our trip to finally checking out was executed by welcoming and friendly staff who seemed to find nothing too much trouble! Our room was superb, spacious and spotless. Well done and thank you to all the staff at the Killyhevlin - cant wait to return again !!
reviews.title: Perfection cannot be improved !!!

reviews.text: Another very enjoyable and extremely comfortable and welcoming stay at Killyhevlin
reviews.title: A Killyhevlin welcome

reviews.text: Attentive and friendly staff Food superb. Room very spacious and spotless. WOULD NOT STAY ANYWHERE ELSE Where else can you enjoy an outdoor spa tub in Fermanagh in January
reviews.title: Can't wait for our next visit!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Killyhevlin for a week over New Year and could not have asked for better service. The room was clean, spacious and tastefully furnished - as is the rest of the hotel. The food was consistently good throughout our stay (especially the chef's chicken goujons - to die for!)
reviews.title: January Blues

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We also frequently used the leisure facilities which are first class.
reviews.title: Never Again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Have been to the killyhevlin a number of times and i am looking for another of their deals.
reviews.title: Excellent ++++++

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I go for weekend breaks and from the moment you arrive you are well looked after by the lovely staff. I never leave unsatisfied, This is by far the best hotel in Northern Ireland,i would strongly recommend a visit.The rooms,food,pool and spa excellent.
reviews.title: Relaxing

reviews.text: Taking a few days respite from the snow, we had a lovely relaxing two day break here. We made full use of the leisure facilities including the outdoor hot tub! Bliss! We upgraded to a lakeview room and I am so glad we did. The room was large with a huge picture window and balcony. The view down the lake was spectacular, what a sight to see each morning when the curtains were pulled back. Ok it was too cold to use the bacony but in warmer months it would be fabulous to sit and have your morning coffee taking in the view.
reviews.title: Good value short break

reviews.text: The food was first class though a fish choice on the table d'hote would have been appreciated.
reviews.title: Superb mid-week break!

reviews.text: The staff are all so friendly, each and every person we passed acknowledged us.
reviews.title: Another Great stay.

reviews.text: Stayed here recently as part of a large group from work.
reviews.title: Noisy, overpriced, disappointment

reviews.text: I'd supposedly been booked into a nice chalet by my employer (at least that's what the documentation said)
reviews.title: more coffee and scones

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was due to stay one night, and despite me querying it, I was put into a small room on the 1st floor. Right smack beside a noisy stairwell, and what sounded like a party/small orgy going on next door.
reviews.title: Excellent weekend break

reviews.text: Anytime the neighbouring rooms used their taps, a pipe in my bathroom squealed waking me many times through the night.
reviews.title: Great for a relaxing break

reviews.text: Speaking to colleagues who were staying two nights, I discovered that they had paid £4 more than me for the extra night AND received an included 4 course meal.
reviews.title: Wonderful setting, service not so wonderful

reviews.text: Stayed in a family room in February.
reviews.title: Sadly disappointed

reviews.text: Pros
reviews.title: First class venue.

reviews.text: The views from the back of the hotel are beautiful
reviews.title: BEST HOTEL

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was clean and well equipped. The main bedroom was modern.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel and Location

reviews.text: Cons
reviews.title: nice place

description: Prepare to be greeted with sheer beauty and style at the award winning 4* Killyhevlin Hotel & Chalets. With breathtaking views overlooking scenic Lough Erne and exclusive Health Club to enjoy- this hotel truly has it all. Surrounded by private grounds and lakeside gardens, this family run hotel is located only 1km from the town of Enniskillen, Co. Fermanagh. Why not go that one step further and spoil yourself at the Elemis Spa.
